credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Elizabeth Haynes
title: Cope
medium:
Medium: cotton, Tussah silk (Z-spun cotton, S-spun silk)
Technique: chain and back stitch embroidery with French knots on two layers of plain weave; inner layer of unspun cotton
description: Small semi-circular cope with a central square flanked by two wedge shapes and framed by a number of borders, all filled by a variety of fantastic and naturalistic birds, animals, huntsman on horses or elephants, woven with palm fronds in seated dance. In golden tan Tussah silk in fine chain stitch with outline and knot stitch fillings and accents on cotton ground now mellowed to a light brown color and covered closely with fine scrolling leaf pattern in same silk in outline stitch. Similar cotton backing caught in with some of the quilting and major embroidery parts.
name: Cope
